metadata.name: Ash to Black Water
metadata.description: Imagine a country that was closed to the outside world for centuries? This is how life was in Japan 160 years ago. Whilst a claustrophobic population ripples with unrest, can the Tokugawa Shogunate's tight grip over a nation possibly be unravelled by small group of individuals? Fact and fiction are combined in this story of how passionate ambition sparked the end of an empire.
